intro: Diodia hyssopifolia var. linearis, commonly known as narrowleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal prairies and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
